intro: Calyptrogyne allenii subsp. allenii, commonly known as the Allen's mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of northern Australia and is adapted to saline and brackish water environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with smooth, waxy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms. Its subspecies status highlights its unique adaptations to specific microhabitats within its range.
